info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 06 at 9:00PM PDT until April 07 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT FRIDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northeast winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts to 40 mph expected. For the Heat Advisory, temperatures of 95-100 Thursday and Friday. * WHERE...San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, through 4 PM PDT Thursday. For the Heat Advisory, through 6 PM PDT Friday. Friday is expected to be the hottest day. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Drink plenty of fluids, stay out of the midday sun. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
